item.title: Sean
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Sean Edwards is a founding member of IS. He comes from a background in operations and engineering at tech startups. Originally from Portland, Maine, Sean has spent the past 3 years working with Boston-based startups to develop tools and processes that keep engineering teams effective while operating at the relentless pace of the technology sector. Combining his professional background in distributed software and systems thinking with a love for the performing arts, Sean specializes in developing systems and teams that turn vision into action. You can follow him on Twitter at @tilmonedwards.

item.title: Marjie
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Marjie has served on many Boards of Directors, and has consulted for numerous non-profits, creating supportive development strategies, lead structures, growth initiatives and group processes for both start-up and existing organizations.
Marjie is the Executive Director of the International Association of Animal Behavior Consultants (IAABC.org) and the co-founder of the Somerville Foundation for Animals and the Somerville Pet Food Bank, which provides pet food to at-risk and homeless families throughout Eastern New England. The Foundation also hosts the Somerville Dog Festival each year.
Marjie lives in Somerville with her chupacapra-cat-beagle mix, Nellie, and is frequently visited by her two sons. She feels coffee is an extremely important part of life.

item.content:encoded: Add your name and then write a short biography here. Bios don't need to be long or complicated - let each member of your team write their own bio to express what matters to them! Set your profile picture using the "featured image" on the right.

item.title: Homepage
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Image"][/siteorigin_widget]

Who we are

We are a non-profit connector for activist organizations born out of the Indivisible Somerville incubator. We've put together this site as a starting point for your organization. It is easy to set up and you can manage events, donations, and volunteers all from Wordpress! This blog theme and demo content are available at no cost to progressive organizations nationwide.

Interested in working with us? You can reach us at link@indivisiblesomerville.org.

[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Button"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Facts"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="SimpleCalendar\\Widgets\\Calendar"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Testimonials"][/siteorigin_widget]

This Fight Needs You

This is where you put your pitch for why you want people to join your organization.

The Join button opens a form that a visitor can fill out. You can customize the questions, and the results will be stored in Wordpress as well as emailed to you. It's easy to track requests and information about members.

[siteorigin_widget class="WP_Widget_Custom_HTML"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Portfolio"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Video"][/siteorigin_widget]

DONATE TO US

A good donation plea lets people know why donating to you will have an impact, and what sorts of activities it will be used for. Donations are handled via PayPal, which is easy and simple to set up and track.

[siteorigin_widget class="Give_Forms_Widget"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Blog"][/siteorigin_widget]

Who we are

We are a non-profit connector for activist organizations born out of the Indivisible Somerville incubator. We've put together this site as a starting point for your organization. It is easy to set up and you can manage events, donations, and volunteers all from Wordpress! This blog theme and demo content are available at no cost to progressive organizations nationwide. Interested in working with us? You can reach us at item.title: Our Story
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
OUR MISSION

This is the place to put your mission statement. Mission statements are concise and get to the heart of what your organization does and how it does it. They should be outcome-oriented and broad, so that future actions and initiatives can fit into your group's mission. For a thorough guide to mission statements, check out the Community Toolbox.

[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Services"][/siteorigin_widget]
[siteorigin_widget class="Athemes_Employees"][/siteorigin_widget]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Customizing Your Site
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In this guide, we'll walk through each section of the website to help you set it up with your own text, pictures, and links.

Homepage

Time: 10 minutes Materials:
  • One 500px x 500px image (Instagram image works!). This will be the first thing your visitors see.
  • A short blurb of what your organization does, and a contact email address
  • A few facts and statistics you want to highlight about the group (press mentions, number of members, number of actions).
  • A short pitch for joining
  • A link to a youtube or vimeo vide you'd like to showcase
  • A short donation pitch
That's it! Let's start editing.

Getting Started

In the Wordpress sidebar, go to Pages > All Pages and edit the Homepage. The Homepage uses a plugin called Page Builder, which visually organizes the page into rows and blocks. Make sure you're on the Page Builder tab to see it. We will go through each row in the page builder and fill it in with the things you prepared above!

Intro Row

In the first row, hover over Talon: Image and click Edit.Click the big Upload Image button. Select and add the 500pm x 500px image you prepared earlier and click Done. Next, hover over the Text widget to the right of the image and click Edit. Enter your blurb and your contact email and click Done. Update the page and preview it to make sure everything looks right.
Hint: Adjust the length of the text to look good next to the image.

Facts Row

Hover over Talon: Facts and click Edit. Write down a name ("members"), and number ("33"), and an icon name. You can choose icons from this set. Click done when you're ready, Update the page and preview it to make sure everything looks good.
Hint: Don't worry too much about the content of the facts or having an exact number - they are just simple things you want to highlight and you can update them whenever you remember.

Calendar Row

The Calendar will not work at the moment and requires a few extra steps to complete. We'll come back to it in the Calendar Setup section below - you can leave it as is for now.

Join Row

Edit the Text widget to the right of Talon: Testimonials and paste in your text asking people to join. Keep this short and simple. You can edit the contents of the form later using the Join Form Setup guide below.

Gallery Row

The gallery section is called "Portfolio" in the Page Builder and holds "Projects". You don't have to make any changes on the homepage, just edit the projects we set up for you with the instructions in the Gallery (Projects) Setup section below.

Donate Row

Edit the Talon: Video box and add the link to the video you'd like to showcase. To the right, edit the Text box and paste in your donations pitch. You can connect your Paypal account to the Donate button later in the Donations Setup section. Save your work and review the page, making any adjustments you need. Congrats, you have built your very own homepage!

Our Story

Next, we'll edit the Our Story ("About") page, which contains your mission, values, and team. Time: 5 minutes Materials:
  • A short mission statement

Mission Row

In the page builder, hover over the first row of text and click Edit. Change the mission statement to your organization's mission statement.

Values Row

You can edit the content of the values row by following the Values (Services) Setup steps below.

Team Row

You'll configure the people displayed in the Team row later by following the Team (Employee) Setup steps below.
Hint: If only one team member shows up, make sure when you edit this widget, the "Number of employees to show" box reads -1 (this means "show all")
Update the page and review to make sure everything looks good. Next, we'll go into the widgets to customize some of the content we couldn't edit on the pages, like the calendar, values, and team members. These are fairly simple to edit and we'll guide you through it step by step.

Widgets

Time: 40 minutes Materials:
  • A Google Calendar for your org
  • 2 or more short quotes, member feedback, or quotes from the press about your work (testimonials)
  • 8 photos of your organization and members
  • A Paypal account-linked email address where you want donations to go to
  • 6 values chosen with your team
  • Pictures and optional short bios of your leadership team

Calendar Setup

Once you have a Google Calendar set up, the calendar requires a bit of extra configuration to add to Wordpress. While this adds setup time, this is the only full-featured calendar that don't add additional subscription costs. You only have to do the setup once, and then it just works. To start, go to Calendars > Settings in the sidebar, and follow the step-by-step guide to getting your calendar key from Google. [events calendar, homepage]

Testimonials Setup

Testimonials is the carousel of quotes on the home page where you can display member feedback or press quotes. In the sidebar, choose Testimonials > All Testimonials. The title is the author of the quote. Edit the testimonial text with the quote you'd like to display, and add an image by changing the featured image on the bottom right. You can list additional information about the quote or author in the "Client info" section at the bottom.

Join Form Setup

Your join form uses Ninja Forms, and you can edit questions or view responses by going to Ninja Forms > Dashboard in the sidebar. You'll see a form called Join Us - click it to begin editing. You can see form responses under Ninja Forms > Submissions.

Gallery (Projects) Setup

To edit the gallery, choose Projects > All Projects from the sidebar and edit or remove any of the projects from the demo site. To set the photo, change the Featured Image on the bottom right.

Donations Setup

To set up your Paypal account, go to Donations > Settings > Payment Gateways > PayPal standard and change the email to match the email on your PayPal account. To change the donation levels, go to Donations > All Forms > Donate and make the changes you want. You can track donations under Donations > Donations. Be sure to test it out once to confirm you are receiving donations in your PayPal account.

Values (Services) Setup

Values are stored under Services > All Services in the sidebar. Edit the description to change the value text. To set the icon, edit the icon under Service info. The available icons are here.

Team (Employees) Setup

To edit your team, navigate to Employees > All Employees and edit the existing team members. To set the picture, update the featured image on the bottom right. Remember to list the person's social media links, and be sure to write out the full link.

Additional Features

The website comes with a few optional features that you are welcome to use or remove. We also show you how to edit the links and social icons in the footer.

Volunteer Management

The volunteer management plugin allows you to list volunteer opportunities, get signups, and track your volunteers. You don't have to use it, but it's a great tool if you want to track and advertise ways to help out. To start, go to Volunteer Mgmt > Opportunities in the sidebar and create some opportunities. There are two types of volunteer opportunities you can create - one-time or ongoing. Once volunteers sign up, they will show up under Volunteer Mgmt > Volunteers. Volunteer opportunities are listed on your volunteer page as well as in the blog sidebar.

Vote Page

Your website comes with a voter registration status check page powered by Vote.org. It is linked from the footer.

Footer

To customize the footer links, go to Appearance > Menus. You can change the links to whatever you like, but we recommend not adding more than 4 per column.

Social Icons

To point the social icons to your organization's accounts, go to Appearance > Widgets, expand Footer 3, and expand Social Icons by WPZOOM. You'll see all the icons and links displayed there - just change them to your accounts and remove the ones you don't need.

Backups

Your Wordpress also includes the UpdraftPlus plugin, which allows you to regularly back up all your content. Look for the UpdraftPlus link in the top bar. Set it to backup your content automatically every two weeks, and be sure to run a backup every time to plan to do any big changes.

item.title: Setting Up Your New Site
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
First, Get Hosting

Before you can have a website, you need a place for it to live. In the world of websites this service is called "hosting", and it's like renting a hotel for your website. Just like there are many hotels, there are many different hosting companies you can use depending on what your needs are. We recommend using Flywheel for hosting because it has a friendly interface, it specializes in Wordpress, and it allows you to pay monthly (Wordpress Business is yearly). However, you are welcome to use whatever hosting service you'd like. If you're not sure what to do, follow the instructions below to get set up with Flywheel.
Note that this site won't work with free Wordpress.com hosting because it requires a custom theme and plugins. You will need to pay for hosting to get things like donations and join forms. Don't worry - it's worth it!
Total Time: 10-15 minutes Cost: ~$15/month
  • Register for an account with Flywheel
  • Create a new Wordpress site and create the Wordpress admin user. Remember this username and password!
  • Choose the Tiny plan, paid monthly, when entering payment info
Additional steps for later:
  • Add and register a domain name if you'd like - a friendly address your visitors can type in to find you faster. We recommend doing this part later, or asking for help as it can be tricky to set up.
  • When you're done and have the domain you want to use, set up a free SSL certificate to make your site safer and more secure. Don't worry if you don't know what it is - the guide above explains it and it's only a few button clicks to set up.
Congrats! Now let's do a little work to get your site looking exactly like this one.

Set Up Wordpress

Total Time: 15 minutes Cost: none In the new few steps we'll choose the theme and import the content so that your site matches the one we have set up.

Get the Theme

  • Log in to your Wordpress site by clicking the "WP Admin" button in Flywheel
  • Under Appearance > Themes, search for Talon and click Install

Get the Plugin

  • Navigate to Plugins > Add New in the sidebar
  • Search for "One Click Demo Import"
  • Choose "Switch to Manual Input"

Get the Content

[zip download]
  • Download the file below and unzip it
  • Upload the three files
Your site should start to look like this one! Good work! Next, we'll go through each section to customize it and make it our own.

item.title: Get Started
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
About the project

In our modern connected world, community organizations need a website to reach existing and potential members and let people know where, when, and how to contribute. But setting up a website for a new organization is hard - you have limited resources, and your volunteer time is valuable. Technology often feels more like a burden than a help. Community organizers need a way to reach new members without making a huge investment in their tech. Indivisible Somerville set out to tackle this problem over the course of several months in early 2018. In addition to talking to groups across the country about their needs, our team analyzed almost 1000 websites of new progressive organizations nationwide to find the sites and solutions that looked good, worked well, and fit the needs of the group without requiring technical skills or resources. We did all the research for you so you can focus on what you do best - engaging your community. Our site is based on the Talon theme, a modern and easily configurable Wordpress theme by aThemes. The theme and content are customized to the needs of progressive organizations like yours, and include all the features to kickstart your organization's technology.

Features

  • Calendar for your events (using Google Calendar with Simple Calendar plugin)
  • A page for your mission, values, and team bios
  • Join form and member tracking (using Ninja Forms)
  • Donations (via Paypal) with built-in donation and donor tracking via Give
  • Volunteer management via Wired Impact
  • Notification bar for important announcements
  • Links to resources, calling tools, and a page to check voter registration status
  • A gallery to showcase your work
Your website will:
  • Work great on phones and tablets
  • Be simple to set up and maintain
  • Include full documentation and require absolutely no code!

Contributing

If you are tech-savvy, we are always looking for helpers! The content of this website is open source on ourGithub. We welcome contributions of documentation, Github issues on bugs, as well as initiatives to take other common Wordpress themes and combine them with the plugins and features needed for activist organizations. These are simple to create and useful for the community. Ready to get started? Follow along as we set up your own Wordpress site!

item.title: Join
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Stand With Us

Whatever skills and time you can bring, there is a place for you in the fight for our democracy. Join us today and see what a difference your voice can make.

item.title: Action

item.content:encoded: We hit the streets for the issues we care about.

item.title: Community
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We care about our cities and our neighbors.

item.title: Environment
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We believe global warming is real and anthropogenic, and we fight its effects.

item.title: Technology
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We use technology for good, and share what we make.

item.title: Healthcare
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We believe access to quality healthcare is a right, not a privilege.

item.title: Instagram
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: You can follow us on Instagram! @indivisiblesomerville

item.title: State House
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We visited the state house in February 2017 to fight for immigrants' rights.

item.title: Candidate Visit
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We had a visit from a candidate for city council.

item.title: Anniversary Celebration
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We turned one year old in January!

item.title: Women's March
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We had a big presence at the Women's March in 2018!

item.title: Cake
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We made a going-away cake for one of our members...it was a huge hit at the bakery.

item.content:encoded: An orientation for new members had great turnout.

item.title: Equality
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Put a short description under each value, and choose an icon to match.

item.title: A Newspaper
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This is a good place to add quotes from your press mentions once you have them. Show off the work you've done in the community to encourage new members to join.

item.title: A Member
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Add your testimonial here - feedback from members is a great place to start. You can also use this space to display a favorite quote.

item.title: Help Us Grow Our Membership
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Do you have a few minutes to lend a hand? This is a volunteer opportunity with our organization. Fill out the form and we'll get in touch with you about your new task. Thanks so much for joining us!

item.title: Gather Signatures
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We need volunteers to join the signature gathering committee and push important state initiatives. Sign up to help and we'll get in touch!
